body_html: I see. Does -march=native automatically use all the instruction sets available in the architecture of the current machine? For example, if the CPU supports the AVX instruction set, will -march=native make the compiler use that?
body_text: I see. Does -march=native automatically use all the instruction sets available in the architecture of the current machine? For example, if the CPU supports the AVX instruction set, will -march=native make the compiler use that?
body: I see. Does `-march=native` automatically use all the instruction sets available in the architecture of the current machine? For example, if the CPU supports the AVX instruction set, will `-march=native` make the compiler use that?
